user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_GetLocalTime_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_GetLocalTime_Impl(OS_time_t *time_struct)
{
    int             Status;
    int32           ReturnCode;
    struct timespec TimeSp;

    Status = clock_gettime(OSAL_GETTIME_SOURCE_CLOCK, &TimeSp);

    if (Status == 0)
    {
        *time_struct = OS_TimeAssembleFromNanoseconds(TimeSp.tv_sec, TimeSp.tv_nsec);
        ReturnCode   = OS_SUCCESS;
    }
    else
    {
        OS_DEBUG("Error calling clock_gettime: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        ReturnCode = OS_ERROR;
    }

    return ReturnCode;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_GetLocalTime_Impl:
#define OSAL_GETTIME_SOURCE_CLOCK CLOCK_REALTIME
...
static inline OS_time_t OS_TimeAssembleFromNanoseconds(int64 seconds, uint32 nanoseconds)
{
    OS_time_t result;
    result.ticks = seconds * OS_TIME_TICKS_PER_SECOND;
    result.ticks += nanoseconds / OS_TIME_TICK_RESOLUTION_NS;
    return result;
}
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
else
    {
        OS_DEBUG("Error calling clock_gettime: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        ReturnCode = OS_ERROR;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: with OS_DEBUG defined as an empty macro the invocation is removed by the preprocessor, leaving a reachable assignment ReturnCode = OS_ERROR; there is no code present in the compiled translation unit that cannot be reached. (Note: the strerror(errno) text is not part of the compiled code when the macro is empty, so it is not "unreachable" — it is absent.)
